content.en:
habitele Program Thursday May 30th
  • 9.30 am: Welcome coffee
  • 10 am: General presentation by Dominique Boullier
  • 10.15 am: State of the art from the results of the survey: the questions to be addressed by Dominique Boullier
  • 10.45 Methodological issues
  • 11.30 am: Debate
  • 12.30: Lunch
  • 2 pm: Case studies. Presentation by each team of one relevant case study (20mn/ team), including a 15mn break
  • 4.50 pm: General debate and proposals for publications
  • 5.45 pm: End of the session
  • 7. pm: Invitation to the cocktail for Bruno Latour’s Holberg prize (Amphitheater Leroy- Beaulieu, 27 rue Saint Guillaume, 75007 Paris)
  • 8.30 pm: Dinner (Restaurant La petite chaise, 36 rue de Grenelle, 75007 Paris)
Friday May 31st
  • 9.30 am: Detailed presentation of the data base and qualitative materials
  • 10.30 am: Discussion of hypothesis n°1 (social worlds switching) on the basis of statistical
  • and qualitative evidence
  • 11.30 am: Discussion of hypothesis n°2 (alert regime)
  • 12.15 am: Short address by Bruno Latour (Sciences Po)
  • 12.30: Lunch
  • 2 pm: Discussion of hypothesis n°3 (privacy)
  • 3 pm: Discussion of hypothesis n°4 (envelope)
  • 4 pm: Presentation of Telecom Paris Tech work on hypothesis n°5 (asymmetry of control
  • between users and operators)
  • 4.30 pm: General debate and perspectives of the Habitèle project
  • 5.30 pm: End of the conference
Contact: dominique.boullier[at]sciences-po.fr

description.en: leader: Dominique Boullier Sciences Po Paris
